## Who are we?

**Project C.L.I.M.A.T.E** (Climate Linked Illness and Morbidity Assessment for Thermal Temperature) integrates community-based participatory research, incorporating art and Traditional Ecological Knowledge to explore the links between climate justice and health equity, with a focus on pregnant mothers and young adults. In partnership with Sri Lankaâ€™s Ministry of Health, the team will use its findings to inform heat exposure guidelines for outdoor workers. Building on previous data collection efforts, the 2025-2026 team will add a strong social science component through socioeconomic surveys, vulnerability mapping, and community-engaged research in kidney disease-affected regions, culminating in a four-week immersive field experience in Sri Lanka.
